entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 9:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Blowing Snow through Tuesday... East winds of 25 to 35 mph are expected in areas along the Dalton Highway south of Prudhoe Bay. Accumulating snow of 2 to 5 inches will fall late tonight and Tuesday, which when combined with wind will result in periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility. Use caution when traveling.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 3:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WINDS POSSIBLE FOR THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... Confidence continues to increase with regards to a strong North Pacific low lifting into the Western Bering Sea by Wednesday. The front will push eastward across the Bering to the Eastern Aleutians by late Wednesday night into early Thursday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Aleutians

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 1:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Through Tuesday... Snowfall and gusty winds between 25 and 35 mph will result in areas of blowing snow through this evening and overnight, with an additional 1 to 3 inches of snowfall accumulation expected through Tuesday. Roads may be slick and will be accompanied with blowing and drifting snow, so expect travel difficulties.
